revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:Agent (''The Matrix'')}} {{Infobox character | colour = #000080 | colour text = white | name = Agent | series = [[The Matrix (franchise)|The Matrix]] | image = Matrix Agents.jpg | caption = From left to right: Agents Brown, Smith, and Jones | first = ''[[The Matrix]]'' | last = | creator = [[The Wachowskis]] | portrayer = [[Hugo Weaving]], [[Robert Taylor (Australian actor)|Robert Taylor]], [[Paul Goddard (actor)|Paul Goddard]] | voice = | episode = | nickname = | alias = | species = Computer program | gender = Male | occupation = Operative, enforcer | title = | family = | spouse = | children = | relatives = | religion = | nationality = }}
'''Agents''' are a group of characters in [[The Matrix (franchise)|''The Matrix'' franchise]]. They are [[sentient]] computer programs carefully disguised as average-looking human males,<ref name="rogerebert"/> displaying a high-level of [[artificial intelligence]].<ref>[http://www.sparknotes.com/film/matrix/canalysis.html "The Matrix Trilogy"]. [[SparkNotes]]. Retrieved 3 December 2014.</ref>
Agents are representatives within the Matrix [[fictional universe]].<ref name="rogerebert"/> They are guardians within the computer-generated world of the [[Matrix (fictional universe)|Matrix]], protecting it from anyone or anything (most often [[Red pill and blue pill|Redpill]]s) that could reveal it as a false reality or threaten it in any other way.<ref name="rogerebert"/>
Agents also hunt down and terminate any rogue programs, such as [[Keymaker|The Keymaker]], which no longer serve a purpose to the overall Machine objective.<ref>[https://www.commonsensemedia.org/movie-reviews/the-matrix "The Matrix"]. [[Common Sense Media]]. Retrieved 3 December 2014.</ref> They physically appear human, but have a tendency to speak and act in highly precise and mechanical ways.<ref name="rogerebert"/>
==Physical aspects== Agents wear black [[Suit (clothes)|business suits]] lined with a gold fabric, white [[dress shirt]]s, black [[dress shoes]], black neckties with a silver [[Tie clip|bar clip]], square [[sunglasses]], and a communication [[Headphones|earpiece]]. These features are copied from the attire for plainclothes agents of the [[United States Secret Service]], as well as those of the [[Men in Black]] conspiracy or the stereotypical [[G-Man (slang)|G-Man]]/[[FBI portrayal in the media|FBI]] official. All Agents are [[Caucasian race|Caucasian]] males (with a minor exceptions of black Agent Perry and female Agent Pace from ''[[The Matrix Online]]'' game), which also provides a dynamic compared to the majority population of Zion, containing many diverse cultures and walks of life. With the exception of Agent Pace, Agents also tend to have common Anglo-Saxon names such as Smith, Jones, Brown, etc. They have sideburns, and their hair is either slicked back or side-parted. Matrix Agents carry [[Desert Eagle]] handguns in shoulder holsters that are concealed beneath their suit jackets. In addition to proficiency in the use of firearms, all Agents are masters of the [[martial arts]] and hand-to-hand combat.
Agents are programmed with a number of [[superhuman]] abilities. An Agent's speed, agility, stamina and reflexes enable them to leap great distances such as across building rooftops, sway their body from side to side to evade gunfire, and perform unusual counter attacks in melee combat (Agent Smith managed to directly counter a punch from Morpheus with a punch of his own to Morpheus's still-moving fist). Agents possess [[superhuman strength]], performing feats such as tearing open a car's roof with one hand and punching through solid [[concrete]]. Although they can be momentarily stunned by certain attacks (such as when Neo jabbed his fingers into Agent Smith's throat), they are generally impervious to pain and injury (the upgraded Agent that Trinity shot in the abdomen and shoulder showed no reaction of pain).
In spite of their abilities, they can be caught off guard with a point-blank [[contact shot]] aimed directly at their head or a barrage of firepower from a weapon with a high rate of fire, such as that from a “[[minigun]]”. Any trauma that is instantly lethal to a vital organ will kill an Agent.
However, being "killed" is a temporary inconvenience, as Agents do not exist in their own bodies as other programs do. Rather, they [[spirit possession|take over]] the virtualized body of a [[Bluepill]]—a human directly connected to the Matrix—which transforms into the Agent's form until the Agent leaves the body. An Agent can jump from one body to another, either to re-emerge in the Matrix if they "die" (which only kills the host body) or to hunt their quarry by taking over a nearby Bluepill. For this reason, areas with a high population density (crowded apartment buildings, market places, freeways, etc.) are usually avoided by the Zion rebels, who regard every Bluepill as potential threat that could become an Agent at any time. Matrix Agents can also disguise themselves as the host body (when Agent Smith possessed the body of a Matrix SWAT soldier and used it as a disguise to locate Morpheus and his crew hiding in the walls of the bathroom).
Beyond their conventional abilities, Agents possess some level of influence over the Matrix to rewrite aspects of itself. In the first film, Agent Smith was able to plant a suggestion that Neo's mouth has sealed shut which made his mouth disappear on his [[residual_self_image#Residual_self-image|residual self-image]] (RSI), and later, the Agents changed the Matrix to trap the rebels inside a hotel by surrounding it with brick walls. It is not explained how this ability works but is most likely based on a line of communication to the Source, rather than an Agent possessing inherent access to manipulate the Matrix's source code.
In addition to their abilities, Agents possess an unspecified level of authority to command civilian law enforcement as both security and first-line enforcers: in particular, they have a heavily-armed SWAT team that serves as their building security. The Agents have branded the Zion infiltrators as terrorists, and the unassuming law enforcement officers will arrest or kill any rebels on the word of the Agents.
With the exception of Smith, who seems intellectually superior to his colleagues (and far more ambitious), Agents show little or no emotion.
==Interaction with Zion infiltrators and other programs== In any direct confrontation, an Agent's abilities ensure they would prevail against a normal human opponent that would eventually exhaust their own firepower, stamina, and capacity to sustain pain and injury. All Zion hovercraft crew members know that Agents are extremely dangerous and virtually impossible to eliminate; as such, they are cautioned to escape upon encountering one. According to [[Morpheus (The Matrix)|Morpheus]], in the time before [[Neo (The Matrix)|Neo]] was freed from the Matrix, every human that had stood their ground against an Agent was killed. Morpheus and Neo both individually fought Agent Smith in the first movie, and both were defeated, only surviving because Smith needed Morpheus for questioning and Neo due to his self-realization of himself as the One. Later, once Neo had harnessed his abilities as the One, Agents no longer posed a threat to him and he could easily disintegrate Smith, scaring Agents Brown and Jones into fleeing. It is implied in the game ''[[Enter the Matrix]]'' that one of the main reasons for Neo's ability to defeat Agents was his ability to focus enough to move quickly for far longer periods than could normal rebels. This is the main cause of the player's difficulty in fighting Agents, since when the player is outside bullet time the Agents are able to dodge and counter all hand-to-hand attacks.
Morpheus had been fortunate enough to survive encounters with two Agents (Smith and Johnson) throughout the trilogy. He was defeated soundly by Smith (who beat him to a bloody pulp but left him alive because he needed information from the high-ranking infiltrator), and only overcame Johnson due to the nature of their situation; he did not wear down his opponent, but merely threw him from the top of the speeding truck on which they were fighting, although he only managed to turn the tables on his foe after he was thrown off, due to the unexpected arrival of [[Niobe (The Matrix)|Niobe]], who rescued him.
Niobe has defeated an Agent, but as with Morpheus, there were extenuating circumstances. The fight took place on board a cargo plane in the skies above the Megacity; Niobe lowered the rear cargo ramp and managed to knock Agent Johnson out of the plane.
[[List of minor characters in the Matrix series#Ghost|Ghost]] has also defeated a single Agent during a raid on a nuclear power plant, again by making use of unique circumstances of the encounter. Agent Johnson challenged him in the control room of the plant, whereupon he damaged one of the high-voltage [[Server (computing)|servers]] with small arms fire and threw his opponent into it, electrocuting him.
The Oracle's bodyguard [[Seraph (The Matrix)|Seraph]] says to Smith in ''[[The Matrix Revolutions]]'': "I have beaten you before," but this is not expanded upon. Smith remarks that chasing Seraph is like "chasing a ghost," suggesting a lasting rivalry between the two programs.
[[Trinity (The Matrix)|Trinity]] is the only other character to have "stood up" against an Agent and survive, given that she dispatched Agent Jones by a [[contact shot]] when he was near to killing Neo, getting in close while the Agent's attention was focused on Neo. If, as Morpheus suggests, no other human had survived an Agent encounter, this would mark the first time that an Agent had been "defeated", albeit the Agent's program then "body hopped" into another Bluepill and was fighting again within minutes.
==Notable film agents== ===Agents Jones and Brown=== In the first film, Agents Jones ([[Robert Taylor (Australian actor)|Robert Taylor]]) and Brown ([[Paul Goddard (actor)|Paul Goddard]]) are credited as Agent Smith's "sidekicks". Smith is given at least one order (or at least a forceful suggestion) by Jones ("order the strike"), and there appears to be some resentment or disagreement between the three on several occasions.
Jones and Brown undergo little character development and do not appear in the sequels, though they are occasionally seen in ''[[The Matrix Online]]''. They are mostly silent, but brutal accomplices to Smith, who perform secondary tasks such as holding Neo in place when Smith places a tracking device (possibly a program) inside his body cavity.
Brown chases Trinity across the rooftops in the opening sequence, missing several shots. Brown is also present in the scene wherein Morpheus is interrogated, injecting a truth serum into Morpheus's neck. Finally, Brown is ordered by Smith to check Neo for life signs after Smith shoots him and confirms Neo's death. Brown shows subtle hints of cynically deriding his "superior" Smith, such as when he seems slightly annoyed at him when they are interrogating Morpheus.
Jones is less prominent than Brown in the first movie, but his most notable scene is a confrontation with Neo in a rooftop fight. He then stands above the stricken Neo, uttering the line "[o]nly human," before being shot by Trinity, who managed to get in close enough to shoot him in the head at [[point-blank range]] while he was occupied with Neo. From this, it can be deduced Jones perceives the human race much as Smith does, though with less unbridled revulsion. Likely as a precaution, Jones is briefly seen in the background holding Brown back when Neo is about to destroy Smith in the end of the film, and they are last seen fleeing from Neo. Jones seems slightly more jaded and bored with his tasks than the other Agents.
===Upgraded Agents=== ''[[The Matrix Reloaded]]'' introduced "Upgraded" Agents, Jackson, Johnson, and Thompson. Their enhanced strength, speed and stamina enable them to engage in protracted combat with Neo. In ''[[The Matrix: Path of Neo]]'', the upgraded Agents recover from violent physical injuries in a relatively short time. However, an unarmed Neo is still able to defeat them easily.
The upgraded Agents continue the use of very plain, common, [[Old English language|Anglo-Saxon]] names. A difference is that now their names are all two syllables and end in "-son", while the original Agents had names consisting of only a short syllable. Agent Johnson appears to be the leader of the upgrades, filling the same role as Smith prior to his first "death". Johnson attempts to destroy the exiled Keymaker program, and fights Morpheus on top of a speeding truck.
=== Rogue Agents === {{main|Agent Smith}} When Smith was destroyed by Neo at the end of ''[[The Matrix]]'', his programming instructed him to return to the Source (the Machine mainframe), either to be destroyed or stored. As a result of Neo's attack, something changed in Smith that allowed him to defy his programming. The change in Smith also disconnects him from the system, setting him "free" from his duties. In effect, this change makes Smith an "Exile" program without purpose. By copying his programming onto others, especially The Oracle, Smith develops similar qualities as the One, such as the ability to withstand dramatic damage and the power of flight. Because Smith feels that he is still a victim to "purpose", he thus makes it his goal to destroy both Zion and The Matrix. Beginning to behave like a [[computer virus|virus]], he makes multitudinous copies of himself by using humans and other programs in the Matrix as hosts. The copies thereafter display the memories and special abilities of any assimilated programs, such as the Oracle's ability to see the future and control over The Matrix. Smith's ability to copy himself onto others may be a corruption of his original ability to move between hosts before Neo's attack. Neo is shown to be the only person able to withstand such assimilations, Morpheus only being spared because Neo threw off the Smiths that were trying to copy over him; even the Oracle fell victim to the attack, although it apparently required greater effort on Smith's part than usual. Smith eventually assimilates the entire Matrix and is destroyed when Neo, co-operating with the Machines, allows himself to be overwritten by Smith after a protracted fight.
Smith's appearance changes slightly once he loses his status as an Agent. His sunglasses take on an angular shape that is an approximation of the rounded lenses Neo uses. In addition, he removes his earpiece and sends it to Neo as a warning.
{{main|The Twins (The Matrix)}} The Twins are believed to be Agents of the second Matrix prototype: the 'Hell' Matrix. When the new Matrix versions were created, along with new versions of the Agents, the Twins were seen as worthless and were sentenced to deletion. However, they avoided deletion and become exiles/rogue programs, working for The Merovingian as bodyguards.
===Other Agents=== Many other agents have appeared in the ''Animatrix'', the Matrix console games, and the Matrix comics. Agents Ash, Bird, Finn, Fine, Gray, and White are the only Agents named there, but other unnamed Agents have appeared as well.
Agent White also appears in ''[[The Matrix: Path of Neo]]'' as a replacement for [[Agent Smith|Smith]] after the latter was destroyed by [[Neo (The Matrix)|Neo]]. White appears in only one section of the Redpill Rescue level called The Security Guard. He appears much like Agent Brown but has his own personality, and appears to be stronger than both Jones and Brown at the time as he gives Neo a fair degree of difficulty, even while Neo is the One.
The ''[[The Animatrix|Animatrix]]'' story ''[[World Record (The Animatrix)|World Record]]'' featured a different style of Agent wearing full-length trenchcoats instead of the usual dark suit.
==Notable MMO agents== The Agents lived on in the film's continuation, the MMORPG ''[[The Matrix Online]]''. In line with the brokered truce created by Neo at the end of ''[[The Matrix Revolutions]]'', Agents were no longer assigned to kill [[redpill]]s on sight. Instead, they guard various areas of the Matrix that are still restricted to the awakened. The Agents revert to their original programming with the collapse of the Truce.
===Impostor Agents=== Red-Eyed "Impostor" Agents appeared at the start of ''The Matrix Online'' storyline during chapter 1.1. These "agents" impersonated system representatives and began widespread sabotage and assaults on the awakened redpills in an attempt to stress/break the truce agreement. All three major organizations ([[Zion (The Matrix)|Zion]], the Machines, and [[the Merovingian]]) were quick to deny being responsible for the attacks and the impostors were soon declared a fourth group unto themselves.
It was soon discovered that these beings were not agents at all, but rather were using some kind of disguise technology to try to implicate the machines for their actions. Glowing red eyes and lack of system-issue firearms were flaws in the plan.
It is revealed in a "Report to the General" document that the Red-Eyed Agents are the General's, the Exile who used to command the Sentinels, commandos, taking into consideration that programs could gain access to other shells (like the way the Oracle changed appearance in the movies), made occasional documented reports to the General in various Zion and Machine critical missions, and also hinted that their disguises were malfunctioning.
=== {{Visible anchor|Agent Gray}} === Gray was one of several Agents trapped in the Matrix during the infestation known as Smith. His program was overwritten with new code, executing instructions which conflicted with his primary architecture. When Smith was defeated and Smith's program was withdrawn from the system, Gray was freed.
The Machine Civilization is run by cautious protocols, and there was still some chance that the Smith code had found a place to shelter within the system, or within an RSI. Agents that had been exposed to Smith were quarantined within the Matrix during the reset – something that is usually never done. Bluepills have their connections to the system attenuated so they never notice the event, and Exiles can seek shelter in a construct, but Agents have no such recourse. Those trapped in the system during the reset were literally turned inside out as their code was deconstructed and recompiled with a vicious error-checking routine.
Even afterward, he has not been allowed to return to the Source, instead relegated to a buffer system created during the reboot – a gateway construct which acts as a Machine analog to the Merovingian's Mobil Avenue Station. In some ways he is almost an Exile, but for the fact that he believes he will eventually be able to return to the Source.
Due to his current situation, Agent Gray was selected to act as recruiter and Controller for human beings that the Machines believe can assist them in controlling the Matrix. Like all Agents he is normally dispassionate and aloof, with a precise manner of speaking, but his forced dealings with humans have left him with somewhat more understanding of them than most Agents.
When dealing with humans, he uses many euphemisms, as he has found that humans often prefer not to say what they really mean. Death is "cessation of awareness"; stealing is "expeditious acquisition". He addresses humans by their gender titles and bluepill last name (e.g. "Mister Anderson"), and seems to have a foolproof way of knowing this information about every human to whom he speaks.
Though Gray resented his assignment greatly at first, he has come to appreciate that he is better at dealing with humans than most other machine Agents. Although he does not enjoy interacting with humans, his efficiency at it gives him a sense of pride.
Occasionally, a remnant of Smith's code has been known to influence his behavior, causing him to develop a misanthropic and homicidal attitude, as well as greatly increasing his power.
Agent Gray is voiced by [[John Patrick Lowrie]].
===Agent Pace=== Agent Pace is the first female Agent, created in ''The Matrix Online'' storyline as an attempt by the Machines to better interact with their human liaisons. Agent Pace is somewhat less stern and more personable than other Agents, and often refers to her human liaisons using [[Italian language|Italian]] terms, almost verging on "pet names" if AI could be said to use them (similar to how the Merovingian program decided that he prefers French over other human languages, Pace likes Italian). "Pace" also means "peace" in Italian.
==See also== * [[Men in Black]] * [[G-Man (Half-Life)|G-Man]] * [[Simulated reality]]
==Sources== {{Reflist|2|refs= <ref name="rogerebert">[http://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/the-matrix-1999 "The Matrix"]. [[Roger Ebert]]. Retrieved 3 December 2014.</ref> }}

{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2012}} {{Eastern Slavic name|Konstantinivna|Prikhodko}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Anastasia Prikhodko
Анастасія Приходько | image = Anastasiya Prikhodko.jpg | caption = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|4|21}} |birth_place = [[Kiev]], [[Ukrainian SSR]], [[Soviet Union]] | death_date = | origin = [[Kiev]], Ukraine | instrument = voice, guitar, flute, piano | genre = [[Folk music|Folk]], [[Rock music|rock]], [[pop music|pop]] | occupation = singer | years_active = 2005–2018 | label = | associated_acts = | website = }} '''Anastasia Kostyantynivna Prikhodko''' ({{lang-uk|Анастасія Костянтинівна Приходько}}: [also spelt ''Prykhodko'']; born April 21, 1987Biography on official website http://anastasya-prihodko.com/ {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090604054931/http://anastasya-prihodko.com/ |date=June 4, 2009 }}{{ru icon}}) is a [[Pop music in Ukraine|Ukrainian]] [[folk rock]] and [[traditional pop]] singer, known for her deep [[contralto]]. On 16 October 2018 Prikhodko anounced on [[Facebook]] that she had decided to end her musical career. At the end of October 2018 Prikhodko anounced she was pursuing a national political career. As a singer Prikhodko won the Russian ''[[Star Factory]]'' contest in 2007 and represented [[Russia in the Eurovision Song Contest 2009|Russia in the Eurovision Song Contest]] on May 16, 2009 in [[Moscow]], where she finished 11th.{{cite news|url=http://www.interfax.com.ua/eng/main/13955/ |title=Results of the finals of Eurovision 2009 |publisher=[[Interfax-Ukraine]] |date=May 17, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090521152913/http://www.interfax.com.ua/eng/main/13955 |archivedate=May 21, 2009 }} In 2014, she vowed never to perform in Russia again because she [[2014 Russian military intervention in Ukraine|accused the country of occupying parts of Ukraine]].{{cite news |url= http://tabloid.pravda.com.ua/focus/53f5bb95094d7/ |script-title=uk:Приходько: Нізащо, ні за які гроші не співатиму в Росії! |language= Ukrainian |trans-title=Prikhodko: Nothing, no amount of money can make me sing in Russia! |publisher= [[Tablo ID]] |date= 21 August 2014}} ==Early life== Anastasia Prikhodko was born in [[Kiev]], [[Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic]] to Oksana Prikhodko[http://www.trud.ru/article/06-04-2010/239556_prixodko_stala_materju.html Труд: Приходько стала матерью] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150210114221/http://www.trud.ru/article/06-04-2010/239556_prixodko_stala_materju.html |date=February 10, 2015 }} and Konstantin Rybalov, a [[Russians|Russian]] miner from [[Rostov-on-Don]].[http://ru.tsn.ua/glamur/skandali/otets-prihodko-popal-v-dtp-avariyu-skryvayut-ot-uchastnitsy-evrovideniya.html Отец Приходько попал в ДТП. Аварию скрывают от участницы «Евровидения» — Скандалы — ТСН.ua] Her parents are divorced. She has an elder brother, Nazar Prikhodko[http://kp.ru/online/news/212188/ Брат Анастасии Приходько Назар: «Я никогда не состоял в УНА-УНСО, потому что не разделяю их политические взгляды» // KP.RU] Her mother is a theater critic and works for the [[Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine|Ministry of Culture of Ukraine]].[http://www.esckaz.com/2009/rus.htm Anastasiya Prihodko (Russia) Biography], www.esckaz.com Her great-grandfather was ethnic [[Japanese diaspora|Japanese]].{{Cite web |url=http://starexpert.ru/2011/07/07/21/11/12 |title=Биография Анастасии Приходько |access-date=December 25, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151226070206/http://starexpert.ru/2011/07/07/21/11/12 |archive-date=December 26, 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }} Prikhodko graduated from the Kiev National University of Culture and Arts, majoring in folk vocal.[http://anastasiya-prikhodko.com/?page_id=304&lang=en Biography], official website anastasiya-prikhodko.com {{dead link|date=December 2011}} ==Musical career== ===Star Factory=== Prikhodko won the seventh edition of the Russian television singing [[Talent show|talent contest]] [[Star Factory]].http://visualrian.com/images/item/174378 {{dead link|date=December 2011}}http://www.musicsrc.com/video/Anastasia+Prihodko+-+Russian+Star+Factory-7+-+Nevesomo.php?id=7uiV6VKZfWo {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160307164600/http://musicsrc.com/video/anastasia%20prihodko%20-%20russian%20star%20factory-7%20-%20nevesomo.php?id=7uiv6vkzfwo |date=March 7, 2016 }} During the show, Prikhodko was filmed telling another contestant that she did not like [[Chinese people]] and [[Black people|blacks]].{{ru icon}} [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z8AbPQW0qG8 Fragment of "Star Factory"], Youtube (March 12, 2009) She apologized about this shortly after the incident. ===Eurovision Song Contest 2009=== ====Ukrainian national selection==== Prikhodko entered the [[Ukraine in the Eurovision Song Contest 2009|Ukrainian national selection for the 2009 Eurovision]] in the semi-final. She was disqualified for performing her own composition, "Vsë za tebya" ("Все за тебя"), from her repertoire for the ''Star Factory'' TV show. The National Jury saw it as a violation of Paragraph 4.3 of the Rules of Eurovision Song Competition issued by the [[National Television Company of Ukraine]] on October 31, 2008 prohibiting performance in the semi-final of anything but the Eurovision entry. In explicit words, the paragraph said: "On 8 February 2009 on the improvised stage set in the NTVU studios, the 30 semi-finalists perform their competition songs live."[http://www.1tv.com.ua/euro/euro2009/eurodoc/ Положення про Національний відбір "Євробачення-2009"] Перший канал {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090422010500/http://www.1tv.com.ua/euro/euro2009/eurodoc/ |date=April 22, 2009 }} Prikhodko's interpretation of the rules was that as her Eurovision entry song "[[Mamo (song)|Mamo]]" had been submitted already in the first round of the competition, the rules did not require her to perform the song before the final. In Prikhodko's understanding, the semi final had been just a showcase of the contestant's vocal talents. She and her manager Olena Mozhova (ex-wife of [[Oleksandr Ponomaryov]], one of the members of the jury) claimed that neither the broadcaster [[National Television Company of Ukraine|NTU]] nor the members of the jury had used trustworthy methods to select the contestants. The duo sent a letter to the [[President of Ukraine]] where Prikhodko stated: "as a citizen of Ukraine, native Kievan, patriot of the country, I was deeply staggered by the impertinent actions and unethical comments of representatives of NTU, and also members of the so-called 'objective, impartial and independent' judges of the competition... I only ask for an honest chance to come forward before an All-Ukrainian audience in the finale of the National selection". The letter was co-signed by Konstantin Meladze and fellow Ukrainian artists [[Sofia Rotaru]], [[Mykola Mozhovyy]] and [[Tina Karol]].{{uk icon}}[http://ua.korrespondent.net/showbiz/756503 Співачка, яка не потрапила у фінал відбору на Євробачення, написала листа Ющенку], [[Korrespondent]] (February 27, 2009) The Ukrainian national final, held on March 8, 2009, was temporarily suspended by a [[court]] based in Kiev due to Prikhodko's protests.{{cite web|url=http://www.esctoday.com/news/read/13451|title=Ukraine: National final to take place tomorrow|last=Hondal|first=Victor|date=2009-03-07|work=ESCToday|accessdate=2009-03-07| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090310110624/http://www.esctoday.com/news/read/13451| archivedate= March 10, 2009 | deadurl= no}}{{cite web|url=http://www.oikotimes.com/v2/index.php?file=articles&id=5284|title=Ukraine: National Final to go on as planned|last=Calleja Bayliss|first=Marc|date=2009-03-07|work=Oikotimes|accessdate=2009-03-07|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090312023916/http://www.oikotimes.com/v2/index.php?file=articles&id=5284|archivedate=March 12, 2009|deadurl=yes|df=mdy-all}} Prikhodko claims, the court ruled in favour of her. By that time, she had already applied for participation in the Russian national selection, calling it "[[destiny|fate]]". {{Listen |filename=Anastasiya Prikhodko Mamo.ogg |title=Mamo |description=Sample from "Mamo". |format=[[Ogg]]}} ====Russian national selection==== Prikhodko entered the final round of the [[Russia in the Eurovision Song Contest 2009|Russian selection for the Eurovision Song Contest 2009]] on March 7, winning with "[[Mamo (song)|Mamo]]"{{cite web|url=http://www.oikotimes.com/v2/index.php?file=articles&id=5289 |title=Anastasia Prihodko to represent Russia in Moscow! |last=Fisher |first=Luke |date=2009-03-07 |work=Oikotimes |accessdate=2009-03-07 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090310145136/http://www.oikotimes.com/v2/index.php?file=articles&id=5289 |archivedate=March 10, 2009 |deadurl=yes }}{{cite web|url=http://www.eurovision.tv/page/news?id=1988|title=Russia votes for Anastasia Prikhodko|last=Omelyanchuk|first=Olena|date=2009-03-07|work=EBU|accessdate=2009-03-07| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090310125627/http://www.eurovision.tv/page/news?id=1988| archivedate= March 10, 2009 | deadurl= no}} ("Mum")[http://diggiloo.net/?2009ru Mamo] Diggiloo.net which was both the viewers' and experts' choice at the Russian national preselection on March 7, 2009. Prikhodko sang her entry in both Russian and Ukrainian. "I'm convinced, when representing one's country, one should sing in the native language," she said:"Russian preselection committee has agreed to my principal condition – to perform "Mamo" in the final of Russian preselection in both [[Ukrainian language|Ukrainian]] and [[Russian language]]s". After the final, Iosif Prigozhin the producer of the losing finalist [[Valeriya]] stated: "A song performed in Ukrainian can’t have anything to do with Russia". Valeriya herself sang in English. Prikhodko's win of the Russian national selection for the 2009 Eurovision sparked allegations of vote-rigging.[http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/article5875152.ece Eurovision vote-rigging row as Ukrainian wins contest to represent Russia], [[The Times]] (March 10, 2009) ====Eurovision Song Contest final performance==== [[Image:Anastasiya Prykhodko.jpg|thumb|right|Prikhodko at the Final of the Eurovision Song Contest 2009]] Prikhodko became the second non-Russian singer (the first being [[Natalia Podolskaya]]) to [[Russia in the Eurovision Song Contest|represent Russia at the Eurovision Song Contest]].[http://www.tophitru.com/newsshowdetale.shtml?id=872 ''To Natalia Podolskaya it almost wasn`t forbidden to start up to Moscow all because of her Belarus passport''], tophit.ru (Februarie 12, 2006) Against the usual Eurovision canons, the final performance did not include choreography but concentrated on Prikhodko's vocal skills and emotions. The giant floating screens at the background featured a video of her face aging from a twenty-year-old to a seventy-year-old.[http://www.eurovision.tv/page/news?id=2490 Russia: Drama in black], ESCToday She finished in 11th place with 91 points. ===Later career=== Producer Konstantin Meladze ended his collaboration with Prikhodko in 2010 and her new partnership with producer Igor Goncharenko ended in May of the same year.{{ru icon}} [http://afisha.mail.ru/article.html?id=27921 Продюсеры отказываются работать с Настей Приходько] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100507162313/http://afisha.mail.ru/article.html?id=27921 |date=May 7, 2010 }}, [[Mail.ru]] (May 4, 2010) Since then her brother Nazar has been her writing partner.{{ru icon}} [http://afisha.mail.ru/article.html?id=28410 Анастасия Приходько снова одна] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100625164041/http://afisha.mail.ru/article.html?id=28410 |date=June 25, 2010 }}, [[Mail.ru]] (June 22, 2010) In August 2010, Prikhodko participated in the casting for the [[Ukraine in the Eurovision Song Contest 2011|Ukrainian representative]] at the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2011]] to be held in Germany.{{cite web|url=http://www.eurovision.tv/page/news?id=19823&_t=Serduchka%2C+Prikhodko+in+Ukrainian+selection|title=Serduchka, Prikhodko in Ukrainian selection|work=[[European Broadcasting Union|EBU]]|first=Jarmo|last=Siim|date=August 19, 2010|accessdate=August 19, 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100822035434/http://www.eurovision.tv/page/news?id=19823&_t=Serduchka%2C+Prikhodko+in+Ukrainian+selection| archivedate= August 22, 2010 | deadurl= no}} On November 21, she qualified for the final{{Cite web|url=http://www.esctoday.com/news/read/16255|title=Ukraine: Anastasiya Prikhodko qualifies for the final|last=Busa|first=Alexandru|date=2010-11-21|work=EscToday.com|accessdate=November 21, 2010}} with her song "Action", a [[minimalist]] English-language [[techno]] number. Although she was one of the favourites for the national final in February 2011,{{cite web|url=http://www.esctoday.com/news/read/16894|title=Ukraine: Mika Newton goes to Düsseldorf|last=Busa|first=Alexandru|date=2011-02-26|work=ESCToday|accessdate=2011-03-21}} she placed eighth.{{cite web|url=http://www.esctoday.com/news/read/16932|title=Ukraine: Anastasiya Prikhodko released new music video|date=February 2011|work=ESCToday|accessdate=2011-03-21}} Prikhodko switched to a [[Ukrainian language|Ukrainian]] repertoire in 2015.{{uk icon}} [https://tabloid.pravda.com.ua/person/5a9d48f0a9f2c/ Prikhodko: I do not know how to cheer people], [[Табло ID]] (5 March 2015) She claimed that this cost her popularity because at the time Ukrainian chart succes was achieved with "funny, cheerful, with inflammatory music or [[Russian language|Russian]]." In 2016, Prikhodko attempted to qualify for the [[Ukraine in the Eurovision Song Contest 2016|2016 Eurovision Song Contest]]. She failed to qualify from the semi-final, finished seventh out of nine contestants.{{cite web|last1=Omelyanchuk|first1=Olena|title=Ukraine: Results of the first semi-final|url=http://www.eurovision.tv/page/news?id=ukraine_results_of_the_first_semi-final|website=eurovision.tv|publisher=[[European Broadcasting Union]]|accessdate=6 February 2016|date=6 February 2016}} On 16 October 2018 Prikhodko anounced on [[Facebook]] that she had decided to end her musical career.{{cite news |url=https://www.obozrevatel.com/ukr/show/people/ya-jdu-zi-stseni-prihodko-zrobila-guchnu-zayavu.htm |script-title=uk: ''Я йду зі сцени'': Приходько зробила гучну заяву |language= Ukrainian |trans-title="I'm leaving the scene": Prikhodko made a loud statement |publisher= [[Obozrevatel]] |date= 16 October 2018}} ===Chart success=== In the April monthly Russian Airplay Chart, "Mamo" placed 78th with 13,716 airings.[http://www.tophitru.com/airplay_month.shtml?month=2009_4 Airplay detection Tophit 100 monthly] Tophit.ru In Kiev April monthly chart, "Mamo" was 24th.[http://www.tophitru.com/kiev_monthly.shtml?week_st=2009_4 Kiev Airplay Top Hit 100] Tophit.ru In May 2009, Prikhodko's "Mamo" peaked at the 12th position of the Ukrainian Airplay Chart,[http://fdr.com.ua/chart/top_40/ Ukrainian Airplay Chart] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140114220828/http://fdr.com.ua/chart/top_40/ |date=January 14, 2014 }} Retrieved on 2009-05-04 22nd of the Russian Airplay Chart,[http://www.tophitru.com/airplay_week.shtml?week_st=1242676800 Airplay detection Tophit 100 monthly] Tophit.ru. Retrieved on 2009-05-07 22nd of the [[Finland|Finnish]] Download Chart,{{cite web|url=http://www.latauslista.fi/lista/2009/21 |title=Suomen Virallinen Latauslista|work=The Official Finnish Download Chart|accessdate=2011-01-21|language=fi}} and 22nd of the Latvian Airplay Top.{{cite web|url=http://www.lanet.lv/news/airplay/new.html|title=Mamo – Anastasia Prihod'ko|work=Latvian Airplay Chart|accessdate=2009-05-22| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090429055503/http://www.lanet.lv/news/airplay/new.html| archivedate= April 29, 2009 | deadurl= no}} ===Artistry=== Prikhodko has an unusually deep [[contralto]] vocal range. Combining this with her folk vocal training, her repertoire comprises atypical songs in a [[minor key]] with a touch of folk style, performed in Ukrainian and Russian. Prikhodko composes some of her songs herself. She plays the [[flute]], the guitar and the [[pianoforte]], with the latter as her favourite instrument. Prikhodko pays great attention to criticism, and always tries to improve herself accordingly.[http://www.rian.ru/ev09_bio/20090307/164160258.html Анастасия Приходько. Биографическая справка] (Anastasia Prikhodko. Biographic data. [[RIA Novosti]][http://www.eurovision.tv/event/artistdetail?song=24711&event=1482 Russia 2009] Eurovision.tv ==Political career== Prikhodko joined the [[Radical Party of Oleh Lyashko]] in the summer of 2015. In September 2015 she stated that she had no ambition to enter the [[Ukrainian parliament]]. On 29 October 2018 Prikhodko anounced on [[Facebook]] that she had decided to join [[All-Ukrainian Union "Fatherland"|"Fatherland"]] and she wanted to become a become a [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|member of parliament]] for this party.{{cite news |url=https://www.obozrevatel.com/ukr/show/ya-zrobila-vibir-prihodko-ogolosila-pro-robotu-z-odnim-iz-kandidativ-u-prezidenti-ukraini.htm |script-title=uk: ''Я зробила вибір'': Приходько оголосила про роботу з одним із кандидатів у президенти України |language= Ukrainian |trans-title= 'I made a choice': Prikhodko announced the work with one of the presidential candidates in Ukraine|publisher= [[Obozrevatel]] |date= 29 October 2018}} ==Personal life== The official site of the Eurovision Song Contest said Prikhodko enjoyed chess, horse riding, and fashion. In a letter to the President of Ukraine, she described herself as a "patriot of the country" and at a February 18, 2009 press conference "a true Ukrainian singer".[http://www.kyivpost.com/guide/35729 Producer Mozhova asks for cancellation of semifinal results of Eurovision 2009 qualification contest], [[Kyiv Post]] (February 18, 2009) In a later interview, she stated there was a: "...spiritual and historical affinity between [[Ukrainian-Russian relations|Russia and Ukraine]]. It would be a sin to forget about one or the other." Prikhodko gave birth to her daughter, Nana, on Easter Sunday April 4, 2010.{{uk icon}} [http://tabloid.pravda.com.ua/news/4bb98bbfefffd/ Приходько вже можна заміж. Співачка народила], [[Табло ID]] (April 5, 2010) And a son called Olexandr on 15 August 2015.{{uk icon}} [http://tabloid.pravda.com.ua/person/55cf631e48606/ Prikhodko became a mother for the second time], [[Табло ID]] (15 August 2015) ===Falling out with Russia=== During [[Euromaidan]], Prikhodko performed on [[Maidan Nezalezhnosti]], where she expressed her support for the [[European integration of Ukraine]].{{uk icon}} [http://fakty.ictv.ua/ua/index/read-news/id/1497589 Анастасія Приходько пишається тим, що заспівала на Євромайдані (фото)], [[ICTV (Ukraine)]] (December 17, 2013) She spoke out for a united Ukraine during the [[2014 Crimean crisis]] and the [[2014 pro-Russian conflict in Ukraine]].{{uk icon}} [http://tabloid.pravda.com.ua/focus/530e1476455c7/ Осадча, Приходько і Саакашвілі виступили за єдину Україну. ВІДЕО], [[Табло ID]] (February 26, 2014){{uk icon}} [http://www.unian.ua/common/918406-15-travnya-v-foye-palatsu-ukrajina-vidbulasya-pres-konferentsiya-blagodiynoji-aktsiji-kontsertu-edina-krajina.html 15 травня в фойє палацу «Україна» відбулася прес-конференція благодійної акції - концерту «Єдина країна»] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140521032410/http://www.unian.ua/common/918406-15-travnya-v-foye-palatsu-ukrajina-vidbulasya-pres-konferentsiya-blagodiynoji-aktsiji-kontsertu-edina-krajina.html |date=May 21, 2014 }}, [[UNIAN]] (May 15, 2014){{#tag:ref|During the [[2014 Crimean crisis]], Ukraine lost control over [[Crimea]], which was unilaterally [[Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation|annexed]] by [[Russia]] in March 2014.[http://eeas.europa.eu/statements/docs/2014/140417_03_en.pdf EU & Ukraine 17 april 2014 FACT SHEET] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140514174415/http://eeas.europa.eu/statements/docs/2014/140417_03_en.pdf |date=May 14, 2014 }}, [[European External Action Service]] (17 April 2014) The status of [[Crimea]] and [[Sevastopol]] is currently under dispute by Ukraine and Russia; Ukraine and the majority of the international community consider Crimea an [[autonomous republic]] of Ukraine and Sevastopol [[cities with special status|one of Ukraine's cities with special status]], while [[Russia]], on the other hand, considers Crimea a [[federal subjects of Russia]] and Sevastopol [[federal cities of Russia|one of its federal cities]]. The [[2014 pro-Russian conflict in Ukraine]] created a [[separatist]] [[insurgency]] in the [[Donbas]] region of [[Eastern Ukraine]] (where several towns became under the control of armed pro-[[Russia]]n forces) and [[2014 pro-Russian conflict in Ukraine#List of proclaimed breakaway states|insurgents declared several provinces unilateral independent]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-26248275 Ukraine crisis timeline], [[BBC News]]{{cite web|last=Gutterman |first=Steve |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/03/18/us-ukraine-crisis-idUSBREA1Q1E820140318 |title=Putin signs Crimea treaty, will not seize other Ukraine regions |publisher=Reuters.com |date= |accessdate=26 March 2014}}|group=nb}} In July 2014 Prikhodko joined a small tour that supported the [[Ukrainian army]] in the [[War in Donbass]].{{uk icon}} [http://tabloid.pravda.com.ua/photos/53d608e819d3a/ Prikhodko sang for the National Garde in Mykolayiv and Kherson], [[Tablo ID]] (28 July 2014) During this tour on [[Twitter]] she stated to [[Russians]] "You guys are stupid. You are narrow-minded and deaf! You are like puppets."{{cite news |url= http://tabloid.pravda.com.ua/focus/53df95a000596 |script-title=uk:Приходько росіянам: Ви вузьколобі, ви глухі |language= Ukrainian |trans-title=Prikhodko to Russians: You're narrow-minded and deaf |publisher= [[Tablo ID]] |date= 4 August 2014 }} Later in August 2014 she vowed never to perform in [[Russia]] again, accusing the country of [[2014 Russian military intervention in Ukraine|occupying parts of Ukraine]] and describing singing for "occupiers" as "the highest betrayal." On August 31, 2014 the Russian television channel [[NTV (Russia)|NTV]] aired a show titled "17 Friends of the Junta" which targeted Prikhodko and other critics of Russia's actions in Ukraine.{{cite news |url= http://www.rferl.org/content/ukraine-singer-prykhodko-rejects-russia/26603773.html |title= 'I Won't Sing For Occupiers' -- A Ukrainian Singer Falls Out With Russia |first= Dmitry |last= Volchek |first2= Claire |last2= Bigg |work= [[Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty]] |date= September 24, 2014 }} She responded, "The very name of the program is laughable." In September 2015 Prikhodko admitted that because of her boycott of Russia her earnings have greatly reduced because half of her concerts used to take place in Russia.{{uk icon}} [http://tabloid.pravda.com.ua/person/55fbe902bfc35 Prikhodko: In politics you can go, but I want to be like Povaliy], [[Табло ID]] (18 September 2015) ==Discography== ===Albums=== *"Заждалась (Tired of waiting)", 2012 *"Я вільна (I Am Free)", 2016 ===Singles=== {|class="wikitable" !rowspan="2"| Year !rowspan="2"| Single !colspan="2"| Chart Positions |- !width="50"|[[Finland]] !width="50"|[[Russia]] |- |rowspan="1"|2008 |"Безответно (Unrequited)" feat. [[Valery Meladze]]Song is available in the music section of Meladze's [http://www.meladze.ru/?lang=en official website] |align="center"|— |align="center"|25[http://tophit.ru/cgi-bin/trackinfo.cgi?id=13648 Безответно] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110831085749/http://tophit.ru/cgi-bin/trackinfo.cgi?id=13648 |date=August 31, 2011 }}, Tophit.ru {{ru icon}} |- |rowspan="1"|2009 |"[[Mamo (song)|Mamo]] (Mama) " |align="center"|22 |align="center"|22[http://tophit.ru/cgi-bin/trackinfo.cgi?id=17604 Мамо] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110831085807/http://tophit.ru/cgi-bin/trackinfo.cgi?id=17604 |date=August 31, 2011 }}, Tophit.ru {{ru icon}} |- |rowspan="1"|2010 |"Action" | |align="center"|62{{citation needed|date=March 2011}} |} ==Notes== {{Reflist|group=nb}} ==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== *[https://www.youtube.com/user/anastasiaprikhodko Official Youtube channel] {{s-start}} {{s-ach}} {{succession box | before=[[Dmitry Koldun]] | title=[[Star Factory|Star Factory (Russia)]] winner | years=2008 | after=''Victoria Dayneko'' }} {{succession box | before= [[Dima Bilan]]
with ''"[[Believe (Dima Bilan song)|Believe]]"'' | title = [[Russia in the Eurovision Song Contest]] | years = [[Eurovision Song Contest 2009|2009]] | after = [[Peter Nalitch]]
with ''"[[Lost and Forgotten]]"'' }} {{s-end}} {{Ukrainian singers of 2000}} {{Russia in the Eurovision Song Contest |state=autocollapse}} {{Eurovision Song Contest 2009 |state=autocollapse}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Prikhodko, Anastasia}} [[Category:1987 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Kiev]] [[Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants of 2009]] [[Category:Russian Eurovision Song Contest entrants]] [[Category:Star Academy winners]] [[Category:Ukrainian female singers]] [[Category:Ukrainian pop singers]] [[Category:Ukrainian rock singers]] [[Category:Ukrainian contraltos]] [[Category:Fabrika Zvyozd]] [[Category:Russian-language singers]] [[Category:English-language singers of Ukraine]] [[Category:Ukrainian-language singers]] [[Category:People of the Euromaidan]] [[Category:Pro-Ukrainian people of the 2014 pro-Russian unrest in Ukraine]] [[Category:Ukrainian people of Russian descent]] [[Category:Ukrainian people of Japanese descent]] [[Category:Batkivshchyna politicians]] [[Category:Ukrainian women in politics]]

{{for|the Spanish Olympic boxer|Andrés Navarro (boxer)}} {{Use British English|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox officeholder | honorific-prefix = The Most Excellent | name = Andrés Navarro García | image = File:Andrés Navarro García 20160520.jpg | image_size = | caption = | office = [[File:Coat of arms of the Dominican Republic.svg|25px]]
[[Foreign Ministers of the Dominican Republic|Minister of Foreign Relationsof the Dominican Republic]] | term_start = 15 September 2014 | term_end = 16 August 2016 | president = [[Danilo Medina]] | predecessor = [[Carlos Morales Troncoso]] | successor = [[Miguel Vargas]] | office2 = Chief of Cabinet of the Ministry of Public Works | term_start2 = 22 April 2014 | term_end2 = 15 September 2014 | alongside2 = [[Gonzalo Castillo Terrero]] (Minister) | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1964|02|04}} | birth_place = [[Bonao]], [[La Vega Province]] (today in [[Monseñor Nouel Province]]), [[Dominican Republic]] | death_date = | death_place = | restingplace = | restingplacecoordinates = | citizenship = | nationality = [[People of the Dominican Republic|Dominican]] | party = [[Dominican Liberation’s Party]] | otherparty = | spouse = | partner = | relations = | children = | parents = | residence = [[Santo Domingo]] | alma_mater = [[Universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo]], [[Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México]] | occupation = Bureaucrat | profession = [[Architect]], [[urban planner]] | cabinet = | committees = | portfolio = | religion = | signature = | signature_alt = | website = http://andresnavarrogarcia.blogspot.com/ | footnotes = | blank1 = Net worth | data1 = }} '''Andrés Navarro García'''{{#tag:ref|{{Spanish name|Navarro|García|plain=yes}}|group="nb"|name=""}} (born 4 February 1964) is an architect, writer, professor and politician of the [[Dominican Republic]]. From 15 September 2014 to 16 August 2016 he was the [[Foreign minister|Minister of Foreign Relations]] of the [[Dominican Republic]]. == Political career == Andrés Navarro has served as: * Director de Política Nacional de Desarrollo Urbano, CONAU (Actual DGODT) – 1998 {{cite web|url=http://www.elcaribe.com.do/2014/04/22/designan-andres-navarro-jefe-gabinete-mopc|title=El Caribe » Designan a Andrés Navarro jefe de Gabinete en MOPC|author=Redacción|work=El Caribe|access-date=23 September 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140924062525/http://www.elcaribe.com.do/2014/04/22/designan-andres-navarro-jefe-gabinete-mopc|archive-date=24 September 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} * Director General de Planeamiento Urbano, Ayuntamiento Distrito Nacional – 2002. * Director Adjunto del Programa de Apoyo a la Reforma y Modernización del Estado – PARME – 2005 - 2008. * Secretario Técnico del Ayuntamiento del Distrito Nacional – 2008 - 2012.Perfil Profesional https://www.blogger.com/profile/00263792292245504676 * Secretario General del Ayuntamiento del Distrito Nacional – 2012 - 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.listindiario.com/la-republica/2012/9/6/246304/Designan-al-arquitecto-Andres-Navarro-como-secretario-general-del-ADN|title=Designan al arquitecto Andrés Navarro como secretario general del ADN|author=Listin Diario|work=listindiario.com}} Fue Director de Gabinete del [[Ministerio de Obras Públicas de la República Dominicana|Ministerio de Obras Públicas]][http://www.elcaribe.com.do/2014/04/22/designan-andres-navarro-jefe-gabinete-MOPC "Designan a Andrés Navarro jefe de Gabinete en MOPC"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140924062525/http://www.elcaribe.com.do/2014/04/22/designan-andres-navarro-jefe-gabinete-mopc |date=24 September 2014 }}. El Caribe (22 April 2014). desde [[abril]] hasta [[septiembre]] del 2014 cuando fue nombrado mediante el decreto presidencial 332-14 Ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la República Dominicana.Decreto 332-14 http://es.scribd.com/doc/239861004/Decreto-332-14 == Notes == {{reflist|group=nb}} == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == {{commons category|Andrés Navarro}} * {{official website|http://andresnavarrogarcia.blogspot.com/}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Navarro, Andres}} [[Category:People from Bonao]] [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:National Autonomous University of Mexico alumni]] [[Category:Universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo alumni]] [[Category:Dominican Liberation Party politicians]] [[Category:Dominican Republic architects]] [[Category:Urban planners]] [[Category:Foreign ministers of the Dominican Republic]] [[Category:Academics]] [[Category:Universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo faculty]] [[Category:Living people]]

revision.text:
{{notability|Biographies|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Bert Biscoe | image = Bert biscoe.jpg | alt = Picture of a Caucasian bearded man with gray hair and glasses standing against a blue background. | caption = Bert Biscoe in 2015 | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1960}} (approx) | birth_place = [[Cornwall]] | nationality = {{Flag|UK}} | other_names = Viajor Gans Geryow | occupation = Bard, Councillor, Historian | known_for = [[bard]] of the [[Cornish Gorseth]] }}
'''Bert Biscoe''' is a [[bard]] of the [[Cornish Gorseth]] also known by the [[bardic name]] '''Viajor Gans Geryow'''.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Tregarthen|first1=J.C.|title=John Penrose : a romance of the Land's End|date=2004|publisher=Cornwall Editions|location=Fowey|isbn=9781904880028|edition=[New ed.].|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=W6FnUJ4ze6cC&pg=PR9&lpg=PR9&dq=bert+biscoe+bard&source=bl&ots=uLhODAsSYI&sig=5Im2skFEgbZxRlUUOm7tWgqjSro&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjHr5nzhaLWAhUkCsAKHQj2ABAQ6AEIWDAJ#v=onepage&q=bert%20biscoe%20bard&f=false|accessdate=13 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Eseli Konsel Gorsedh Kernow|url=http://gorsedhkernow.org.uk/councilmembers.html|website=Gorsedh Kernow|publisher=Gorsedh Kernow|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> He represents [[Cornwall Council]]'s [[Truro, Cornwall|Truro]] [[Boscawen (District)|Boscawen District]] as an independent Cornwall Councillor and [[Truro City Council]] councillor. Bert Biscoe is known locally for his work as a [[Historian|local historian]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Squeeze Guts|url=http://www.cornwalllive.com/news/history/secrets-squeeze-guts-alley-truros-364881|website=cornwall live|publisher=cornwall live|accessdate=29 August 2017}}</ref> and for his [[activist|activism]] related to the [[Cornish people|Cornish identity]] debate.<ref name="auto">{{cite web|last1=Simon|first1=Parker|title=Cornwall wants to go it alone|url=https://www.theguardian.com/society/2001/jan/12/localgovernment.devolution|website=The Guardian|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> In 2012, his book of poems called "Trurra" won a [[Waterstones]] Publishers Award at the Holyer An Gof literary competition.<ref>http://gorsedhkernow.org.uk/HolyeranGof/publication_winners_2012.html</ref>
==Personal life== Bert Biscoe was born in [[Stithians, Cornwall]]. He attended [[Truro School]] and his higher education was completed at [[Bangor University]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Biography|url=http://www.bertbiscoe.co.uk/about.html|website=BB|publisher=Bert Biscoe Campaign|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> He lives in [[Truro, Cornwall]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Bert Biscoe|url=https://democracy.cornwall.gov.uk/mgUserInfo.aspx?UID=2017|website=Cornwall Gov|publisher=Cornwall Council|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref>
==Bardic work== Bert Biscoe is a traditional musician and poet,<ref>{{cite web|title=Dew Vardh, with Bert Biscoe and Pol Hodge|url=http://www.pzlitfest.co.uk/event/dew-vardh-with-bert-biscoe-and-pol-hodge/|website=Penzance Literary Festival|accessdate=13 September 2017}}</ref> specialising in Cornish folk music, some of which is in the [[Cornish language]].<ref>{{cite web|title=A Kynsa|url=http://www.cornwall24.co.uk/viewtopic.php?t=2298|website=Cornwall 24|publisher=Cornwall 24|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> Some of his audio works have been collected into a compilation titled "An Kynsa".
He was created a Bard of the Cornish Gorsedh in 1995 for services to Cornwall with the [[bardic name]] ''Viajor Gans Geryow'', and has been a member of the Council of the Gorsedh since 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gorsedhkernow.org.uk/councilmembers.html|title=Council Members|publisher=[[Cornish Gorsedh]]|accessdate=29 August 2017}}</ref> He is the author of several books of poetry.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jennet Campbell MBE: Cornish Gorsedd Honour - The Radford Charitable Trust|url=http://www.radfordtrust.org/history/jennet-campbell-mbe-gorsedd|website=www.radfordtrust.org|accessdate=13 September 2017|language=en}}</ref> As a bard of the Gorsedh he is regularly in attendance at celebrations of Cornish culture and important cultural occasions.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ceremony welcomes bards from all over the world to Lannstevan|url=http://www.thepost.uk.com/article.cfm?id=108869&headline=Ceremony%20welcomes%20bards%20from%20all%20over%20the%20world%20to%20Lannstevan&sectionIs=news&searchyear=2017|website=Cornish & Devon Post|accessdate=13 September 2017|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Guardians of a rich cultural heritage|url=http://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/guardians-rich-cultural-heritage/story-13155547-detail/story.html|accessdate=13 September 2017|publisher=Cornish Guardian|date=August 18, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Council|first1=Cornwall|title=September 2013 - Cornwall Council|url=https://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:NwyXxkLyjiMJ:https://www.cornwall.gov.uk/council-and-democracy/leaders-blog/september-2013/+&cd=5&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=uk|website=webcache.googleusercontent.com|accessdate=13 September 2017|language=en}}</ref>
His poetry centres on the 'spirit of Kernow', he has performed with other bards in Cornwall.<ref>{{cite web|title=Poets lead Cornish revolt against `English imperialism'|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/poets-lead-cornish-revolt-against-english-imperialism-1262185.html|website=The Independent|accessdate=13 September 2017|date=18 May 1997}}</ref>
==Political career== He is currently an independent councillor in [[Cornwall Council]]'s [[Truro, Cornwall|Truro]] [[Boscawen (District)|Boscawen District]]. He is also a city councillor as part of [[Truro City Council]].
Until 2017, he was Cornwall Council's portfolio holder for transport and was responsible for Cornwall's transport links. He was replaced by Councillor Geoff Brown.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cornwall.gov.uk/council-and-democracy/profiles-of-cabinet-members/|title=Profiles of Cabinet members - Cornwall Council|first=Cornwall|last=Council|website=www.cornwall.gov.uk}}</ref> During his time in office, he was involved in many projects including the [[A30 road]] improvements at [[Temple, Cornwall]],<ref>{{cite news|title=A30 improvements finish date moves from spring to summer|url=http://www.itv.com/news/westcountry/2017-01-19/a30-improvements-finish-date-moves-from-spring-to-summer/|accessdate=29 August 2017|agency=ITV news|publisher=ITV|date=19 January 2017}}</ref> and one of the failed bus lane projects in [[Truro]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Scrapping of Truro bus lane costs £60,000|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-cornwall-34883680|accessdate=29 August 2017|agency=BBC Cornwall|publisher=BBC|date=20 November 2015}}</ref>
==Work as local historian== He is the Chairman of the Truro Civic Society, a registered charity based in Truro,<ref>{{cite web|title=TCS|url=http://trurocivicsociety.com/|accessdate=29 August 2017}}</ref> he is also current President of the [[Truro Old Cornwall Society]].<ref>{{cite web|title=piran day article|url=http://www.falmouthpacket.co.uk/news/15070872.Details_of_this_years_St_Piran__39_s_Day_procession_announced/|website=falmouth packet|accessdate=29 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Truro Old Cornwall Society|url=http://www.oldcornwall.net/truro-ocs/4576250937|website=Truro Old Cornwall Society|accessdate=12 September 2017}}</ref> He is also the honorary secretary and a trustee on the board on the [[Royal Cornwall Museum]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Trustees|url=http://www.royalcornwallmuseum.org.uk/about-the-museum/trustees-2|website=Royal Cornwall Museum|publisher=Royal Cornwall Museum|accessdate=29 August 2017}}</ref> He is the author of two books about the history of Cornwall.<ref>Truro Library Archives</ref>
==Activism== Bert Biscoe is a relevant figure in the [[Cornish people|Cornish Identity]] debate and has campaigned for increased powers for Cornish local government and the creation of a [[Cornish Assembly]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://democracy.cornwall.gov.uk/mgUserInfo.aspx?UID=2017|title=Councillor details|accessdate=13 August 2017}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bertbiscoe.co.uk/about.html|title=About Bert Biscoe|accessdate=13 August 2017}}</ref> He has been the chair of the [[Cornish Constitutional Convention]].<ref name="auto"/>
==Books== Bert Biscoe is the author of several books, mainly related to Cornwall and poetry. *''MAUDLIN' PILGRIMAGE'', book of verse set in the reign of [[Henry VIII]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Bert|first1=Biscoe|title=MAUDLIN' PILGRIMAGE|url=http://www.oldcornwallshop.net/shop-page/4578430537/'maudlin'-pilgrimage-by-bert-biscoe/6275340|website=oldcornwallshop|publisher=BB|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> *''Rebecca'', (1996).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://openlibrary.org/works/OL11611784W/Rebecca|website=Open Library |title=Rebecca |accessdate=18 October 2017}}</ref> *''The dance of the Cornish air'', (1996).<ref>{{cite web|title=the dance of the cornish air|url=https://openlibrary.org/works/OL11611783W/The_dance_of_the_Cornish_air|website=Open Library|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> *''At a wedding with Yeats in Turin'', (2003).<ref>{{cite web|title=At a wedding with Yeats in Turin|url=https://openlibrary.org/works/OL11611782W/At_a_wedding_with_Yeats_in_Turin|website=Open library|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> *''Trurra'', Published by ''Dew Vardh'', winner of the Waterstones Award at Holyer An Gof Publishers' Awards 2012.<ref>{{cite web|title=gorsedh kernow awards list|url=http://gorsedhkernow.org.uk/HolyeranGof/publication_winners_2012.html|website=gorsedh kernow|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> *''Words of Granite'' ({{ISBN|9780946143269}}).<ref>{{cite book|last1=Biscoe|first1=Bert|title=Words of granite : bearing witness : poems of time & place|date=1997|publisher=Lodenek Press|location=Wadebridge|isbn=9780946143269|page=53 |edition=1|url=https://biblio.co.uk/book/words-granite-selected-poems-bert-biscoe/d/956729010|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Biscoe|first1=Bert|title=Words of Granite - Selected Poems|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Words-Granite-Selected-Bert-Biscoe/dp/0946143269|website=amazon books|publisher=Lodenek Press|accessdate=30 August 2017|language=English|date=1997}}</ref> *''Mercifully Preserved'' Fictional account of the life of [[Sir John Betjeman]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://oldcornwall.net/shop-page/4578430537/'mercifully-preserved'-by-bert-biscoe/6275356|title=oldcornwall|website=oldcornwall.net}}</ref> *''On Yer Trolley: Poems Made During Complete Bed Rest!'', (2008).<ref>{{cite web|last1=Biscoe|first1=Bert|title=On Yer Trolley: Poems Made During Complete Bed Rest!|url=https://www.amazon.com/Yer-Trolley-Poems-During-Complete/dp/0956021816/ref=asap_bc?ie=UTF8|website=Amazon|publisher=Creative Edge|accessdate=30 August 2017|date=5 December 2008}}</ref> *''White Crusted Eyes: Tales of Par'', (2009).<ref>{{cite web|last1=Biscoe|first1=Bert|title=White Crusted Eyes: Tales of Par|url=https://www.amazon.com/White-Crusted-Eyes-Tales-Par/dp/0956021824/ref=asap_bc?ie=UTF8|website=Amazon|publisher=Creative Edge|accessdate=30 August 2017|date=1 September 2009}}</ref> *''MEDITATIONS ON CARN BREA Poems and Pictures from a Cornish Hill'', (2005).<ref>{{cite web|title=MEDITATIONS ON CARN BREA Poems and Pictures from a Cornish Hill by Biscoe Bert: Biffworks, Cornwall Thin Card, First Edition, Signed by Author(s) - Polsue Books|url=https://www.abebooks.co.uk/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=15098266886&searchurl=sortby%3D17%26an%3Dbert%2Bbiscoe%2Bcliff%2Bjones|website=www.abebooks.co.uk|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> *''Accompanied by Larks''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Accompanied by Larks - BISCOE, Bert|url=http://www.cornishbookworld.co.uk/?page=shop/flypage&product_id=62730&keyword=bert+biscoe&searchby=author&offset=0&fs=1|website=www.cornishbookworld.co.uk|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref>
